08:00 <@cjdelisle> What kind of chat client?

08:01 <qwebirc44960> @tekzilla: I provide the same domain name in the sm.xml,c2s.xml file and while creating the account through pigdin  
08:02 <tekzilla> ok sorry it was just a wild guess

11:08 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: this time platform is complete and deployed, promise ;)  
11:08 <+tmortagne> http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-wiki-manager-api  
11:18 <+Enygma`> tmortagne: cool! Any news for the xem war to go along with it?  
11:29 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: it should build fine now i guess  
11:29 <+tmortagne> since it was only missing wiki-manager I think  
11:30 <+tmortagne> but there is an issue with XE war build, i'm currently working on it  
11:32 <+tmortagne> actually I think I just fixed it (it was using the wrong parent which does not produce license)  
11:32 <+tmortagne> lets see what jenkins think bout it  
11:37 <lucaa> has quit  
11:39 <+tmortagne> somes issue remaining with XE distribution bu that's ok for XEM war  
11:41 <+tmortagne> ha no that's because i was building with -o :)

12:14 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
12:15 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
12:23 <+Enygma`> yes, xem war is now built. Cool!  
12:23 <+Enygma`> I`ll give it a try soon.  
12:24 <+Enygma`> but I have a maven question tmortagne: if I`m building a war by using the xem war as base and then overlaying some other wars... how can I enhance the web.xml of the xem war? If I add a web.xml in one of my overlayed wars, will that override xem`s web.xml or merge it?  
12:24 <+Enygma`> I`m thinking it will override, right?  
12:29 <drake01> has quit  
12:29 <+tmortagne> i think it merge actually, you can find example of that between web-standard and wysiwyg war  
12:29 <+tmortagne> ( Enygma` )  
12:30 <+Enygma`> ah, I see. Thanks

13:53 <saablover> has joined #xwiki  
13:54 <saablover> hi people is it possible to execute a script when certain values are changed in the wiki ?  
13:55 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:55 <saablover> I have a list like this: IP address? Hostname? Function? When someone adds an ip and a hostname, I want to be able to execute a script with these two values  
13:57 <@sdumitriu> Hi saablover  
13:57 <@sdumitriu> Sure, you can use event listeners  
13:57 <@sdumitriu> There's a tutorial, let me find it  
13:58 <@sdumitriu> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/GroovyNotificationTutorial  
14:09 <saablover> thx !

14:29 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:30 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Read the chat about git branches from yesterday  
14:30 <@sdumitriu> What you did wrong was to rebase on top of master  
14:30 <@sdumitriu> Rebase rewrites all commits  
14:31 <@sdumitriu> So, you had commits R1 and R2 on top of M1, which you pushed to the feature branch on the origin  
14:32 <@sdumitriu> Then you rebased them on top of M2, the new HEAD of master, which creates R1' and R2'  
14:32 <@sdumitriu> R1' is not the same as R1, so when you try to push to origin, you have a conflict between the old R1 on origin and the new R1' on local  
14:33 <lucaa> has quit  
14:37 <@sdumitriu> When working with feature branches that are already committed, you can either merge (no rebase), or ignore the master completely and only merge onto master when done  
14:38 <@sdumitriu> If you do want to rebase, you can push --force, hoping that nobody else committed in the origin branch  
14:42 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
14:47 <@sdumitriu> abusenius: Read the end of http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/xwikiArchive20110414?xpage=plain  
14:49 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: ok thanks a lot !  
14:53 <+tmortagne> never fully understood difference between rebase and merge  
14:54 <+abusenius> reading  
14:57 <+abusenius> ah ok, I've suspected something like that  
14:58 <+abusenius> it's much easier with local branches  
14:58 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
14:58 <@sdumitriu> Once you push to a remote, you can't mess with history anymore  
14:58 <@sdumitriu> Well, you \*can\*, but you really shouldn't  
14:59 <+abusenius> we need to update the docu about working with the repository etc  
14:59 <+tmortagne> good news: the whole XWiki github is now building fine on Jenkins  
14:59 <@sdumitriu> Yay!  
14:59 <+abusenius> cool  
14:59 <+tmortagne> TODO:  
14:59 <+tmortagne> \* find how to make buildnumber plugin works with git  
15:00 <+tmortagne> \* find a way to make platform build without xar handler built before  
15:01 <+tmortagne> don't have much hope for the last one, looks like it's a maven 3 limitation or bug that make impossible to build and use an extension in the same build  
15:01 <+tmortagne> \* finally put all the contrib stuff on github probably in another organisation  
15:03 <+tmortagne> hmm was a bit too quick, looks like XEM integration test have some issues  
15:04 <+tmortagne> but at least it's building  
15:19 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: We also need a pom for xwiki-trunks  
15:19 <@sdumitriu> Can you take care of it?  
15:19 <+tmortagne> sure  
15:20 <+tmortagne> another TODO:  
15:20 <+tmortagne> \* find what to do for xwiki-debug-eclipse, i can't find any equivalent to svn externals for files and folders in git  
15:20 <+tmortagne> submodule only targets whole repositories as far as i can see  
15:21 <@sdumitriu> Yes, that's why I said it should be done with symlinks  
15:22 <+tmortagne> that would not work for anyone using windows  
15:23 <+tmortagne> i'm not big fan of making impossible to use filesystems which don't support symlinks  
15:26 <cjdelisle> has quit  
15:27 <@sdumitriu> NTFS in Vista/7 supports symlinks to directories  
15:28 <+tmortagne> (pom.xml for xwiki-trunks done)  
15:29 <abusenius> has quit  
15:29 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: and files ?  
15:30 <@sdumitriu> Probably not  
15:30 <+tmortagne> only solution I see right now is to get back to my pre svn 1.6 solution which was to define Eclipse variables  
15:31 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Wrong parent relativePath, I'll fix it  
15:31 <+tmortagne> right, sorry  
15:31 <kasun> has joined #xwiki  
15:32 <+tmortagne> hmm actually i think it should not have any parent

16:03 <+mflorea> tmortagne: is there a way to get a request parameter inside a component without accessing the old XWiki context?  
16:04 <+tmortagne> mflorea: that's kind of xwiki-url job i think but we are not using that yet so no i don't think there is any way  
16:04 <+tmortagne> did you look at bridge ?  
16:04 <+mflorea> I'm thinking to write a RequestConfigurationSource (hint=request) and I don't want to depend on the old core  
16:04 <+tmortagne> if it's not in bridge I doubt there is any way right now  
16:05 <+tmortagne> you can implement it on oldcore  
16:05 <+mflorea> indeed
